articles.snippet: First of all, she prefers to be called Coco.
articles.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England — Cori Gauff, the 15-year-old sensation, made one of the most memorable Wimbledon debuts in recent memory by beating Venus Williams on Monday. And she didn’t stop there: she won two more matches and is now the youngest woman to reach the second week of a Grand Slam tournament since 15-year-old Jennifer Capriati at Wimbledon in 1991. Gauff will play Simona Halep in a fourth-round match on Monday.
articles.abstract: First of all, she prefers to be called Coco.

headline.main: Cori Gauff: 10 Things to Know About the Newest Tennis Phenom

articles.snippet: Chris Evert was 16 when she dazzled at the U.S. Open in 1971. But, she noted, with less television and no social media, “it was just a different world.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England — Whatever happens in the second week of Wimbledon, Coco Gauff already has made a huge impact less than four months after turning 15.
articles.abstract: Chris Evert was 16 when she dazzled at the U.S. Open in 1971. But, she noted, with less television and no social media, “it was just a different world.”

headline.main: Other Teen Prodigies to Coco Gauff: ‘Don’t Read Everything About You’

headline.main: Jeffrey Epstein, Turkey, Coco Gauff: Your Tuesday Briefing

articles.snippet: The 15-year-old American had captured attention worldwide with three wins at her first Grand Slam tournament.
articles.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England — We were there for Coco Gauff’s first Wimbledon, which ended on Monday with a 6-3, 6-3 defeat to Simona Halep.
articles.abstract: The 15-year-old American had captured attention worldwide with three wins at her first Grand Slam tournament.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Loses to Simona Halep, Ending Magical Wimbledon Run
headline.print_headline: Gauff Ran Out of Magic, but What a Ride

articles.snippet: Gauff, 15, won a qualifying match in the Citi Open weeks after her star-making Grand Slam debut. An age eligibility rule prevented her from directly making this event’s main draw.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In her first stop after four matches on Wimbledon’s biggest courts, Coco Gauff and her rising star illuminated the Citi Open on Saturday in the nation’s capital.
articles.abstract: Gauff, 15, won a qualifying match in the Citi Open weeks after her star-making Grand Slam debut. An age eligibility rule prevented her from directly making this event’s main draw.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Draws a Crowd Even Without Wimbledon’s Pageantry
headline.print_headline: Gauff, Fresh From London, Takes Up the Unglamorous Work of Qualifying

articles.snippet: Playing in a small venue in the middle of the day in Washington, Gauff drew a capacity crowd. Zarina Diyas beat her easily.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even though she scaled back in terms of her stage and result, Coco Gauff, 15, continued to be the sensation of the summer in defeat on Tuesday.
articles.abstract: Playing in a small venue in the middle of the day in Washington, Gauff drew a capacity crowd. Zarina Diyas beat her easily.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Fans Scramble for an Up-Close Look, Even in Defeat
headline.print_headline: Gauff Fans Scramble to Get an Up-Close Look, Even in Defeat

articles.snippet: Four players 17 or younger are in the top 150 of the WTA rankings. All of them are American.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Coco Gauff’s breakthrough run to the fourth round of Wimbledon was hailed as the arrival of a singular talent. Through a wider lens, though, she is one of many.
articles.abstract: Four players 17 or younger are in the top 150 of the WTA rankings. All of them are American.

headline.main: It’s Not Just Coco Gauff: American Teens Swarm Into Pro Tennis
headline.print_headline: Gauff Leads Surge of Talented Young Americans in WTA

articles.snippet: Gauff, 15, teamed with Caty McNally, 17, to claim the doubles crown at an event in Washington. Gauff said they want to win together again at the U.S. Open.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The surging American teens in women’s tennis now have a trophy to show for their breakout summer, after two of them, Coco Gauff and Caty McNally, claimed the doubles title at the Citi Open on Saturday.
articles.abstract: Gauff, 15, teamed with Caty McNally, 17, to claim the doubles crown at an event in Washington. Gauff said they want to win together again at the U.S. Open.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Wins First WTA Title at Citi Open
headline.print_headline: Gauff Shares Her First WTA Title and Sets Her Sights on the U.S. Open

articles.snippet: How far should boxing go to keep fighters safe in an inherently dangerous sport? Plus Daniel Jones, Alejandro Bedoya, Coco Gauff and Caty McNally.

articles.abstract: How far should boxing go to keep fighters safe in an inherently dangerous sport? Plus Daniel Jones, Alejandro Bedoya, Coco Gauff and Caty McNally.

headline.main: Protecting Athletes From Themselves

articles.snippet: Gauff, the 15-year-old who starred at Wimbledon last month, will play in her second Grand Slam main draw.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States Open announced its wild-card decisions on Tuesday, confirming that Wimbledon’s breakout star, Coco Gauff, had been chosen for the tournament’s main draw.
articles.abstract: Gauff, the 15-year-old who starred at Wimbledon last month, will play in her second Grand Slam main draw.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Will Play in the U.S. Open as a Wild Card
headline.print_headline: Gauff Gains Wild-Card Entry to U.S. Open

articles.snippet: The 15-year-old tennis player practices in a Florida city that once renamed itself “Tennis Beach.” She’s the rare player whose South Florida training ground is her birthplace.
articles.lead_paragraph: DELRAY BEACH, Fla. — You could stand on the street and hear the teenager’s squeaking sneakers as she sped up and stopped on Court No. 4.
articles.abstract: The 15-year-old tennis player practices in a Florida city that once renamed itself “Tennis Beach.” She’s the rare player whose South Florida training ground is her birthplace.

headline.main: Coco Gauff’s Tennis Haven Happens to Be Her Hometown
headline.print_headline: She Was Born in a Tennis Town. Now She’s the Toast of It.

articles.snippet: Coco Gauff wins her Open debut; upsets take out Sloane Stephens and several top men; and Naomi Osaka escapes with a victory.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sloane Stephens, the 2017 United States Open champion, bid toward a second title ended abruptly in the first round on Tuesday night, falling to the qualifier Anna Kalinskaya, 6-3, 6-4.
articles.abstract: Coco Gauff wins her Open debut; upsets take out Sloane Stephens and several top men; and Naomi Osaka escapes with a victory.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open: Highlights From Day 2

byline.original: By Ben Rothenberg and David Waldstein

articles.snippet: Gauff, the 15-year-old breakout star of Wimbledon, fought back from a first-set loss to defeat Anastasia Potapova, an 18-year-old from Russia.
articles.abstract: Gauff, the 15-year-old breakout star of Wimbledon, fought back from a first-set loss to defeat Anastasia Potapova, an 18-year-old from Russia.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Delivers Again, in an Electric U.S. Open Win
headline.print_headline: A Joy Ride Bounds Onto the Concrete

articles.snippet: On a day when dozens of matches were postponed by rain, Serena Williams held off a young opponent and Novak Djokovic fought through an aching shoulder.
articles.lead_paragraph: After the 15-year-old Coco Gauff defeated Venus Williams in her first match at Wimbledon last month, Gauff’s doubles partner, the 17-year-old Caty McNally, had a puncher’s chance at an even bigger upset in her first United States Open. She won the first set against Serena Williams in their second-round match before Williams rallied to prevail, 5-7, 6-3, 6-1.
articles.abstract: On a day when dozens of matches were postponed by rain, Serena Williams held off a young opponent and Novak Djokovic fought through an aching shoulder.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open: Highlights From a Rainy Day 3

byline.original: By Christopher Clarey and Naila-Jean Meyers

articles.snippet: Gauff will next face Naomi Osaka; the former teen phenom Taylor Townsend upset No. 4 Simona Halep for the biggest win of her career.
articles.lead_paragraph: In just the second United States Open singles match of her life, 15-year-old Coco Gauff did an excellent impression of a veteran on Thursday night: keeping her cool, measuring her risks and making the shots that mattered most.
articles.abstract: Gauff will next face Naomi Osaka; the former teen phenom Taylor Townsend upset No. 4 Simona Halep for the biggest win of her career.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open Highlights: Coco Gauff Wins the Night
headline.print_headline: A Win That Shows Guile Beyond Her Years

articles.snippet: Gauff, the 15-year-old prodigy, will face Osaka, the world’s No. 1 player, in a tournament for the first time in the third round of the United States Open.
articles.lead_paragraph: Coco Gauff, a 15-year-old American tennis prodigy, and Naomi Osaka, the world’s No. 1 player, will face each other in a tournament for the first time when they meet in the third round of the United States Open on Saturday.
articles.abstract: Gauff, the 15-year-old prodigy, will face Osaka, the world’s No. 1 player, in a tournament for the first time in the third round of the United States Open.

headline.main: Coco Gauff Has Won Over the Crowd. Now She Needs to Beat Naomi Osaka.
headline.print_headline: The Cocomania Juggernaut Roars Toward the World No. 1

articles.snippet: Osaka, the No. 1 seed and reigning champion, advanced to the fourth round by beating the 15-year-old who has captivated the tennis world this summer.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a short match long on emotion, Naomi Osaka, the world’s No. 1 player, ended the latest Grand Slam run by the 15-year-old American Coco Gauff in the third round of the United States Open.
articles.abstract: Osaka, the No. 1 seed and reigning champion, advanced to the fourth round by beating the 15-year-old who has captivated the tennis world this summer.

headline.main: Naomi Osaka Knocks Coco Gauff Out of the U.S. Open
headline.print_headline: World No. 1 Eliminates, and Embraces, Young Upstart

articles.snippet: Gauff’s tennis dress during the U.S. Open features images of public courts throughout the five boroughs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fans who have filled courts to the last row hoping to catch a glimpse of Coco Gauff at the United States Open may have admired her outfit, which appears from a distance to feature a retro tile pattern evoking the 1950s or 60s. Those with a closer vantage point may have guessed doors or windows.
articles.abstract: Gauff’s tennis dress during the U.S. Open features images of public courts throughout the five boroughs.

headline.main: Look Closely for Coco Gauff’s Homage to New York Tennis

articles.snippet: There’s more than one great match on the schedule. Rafael Nadal, Nick Kyrgios, Caroline Wozniacki and Taylor Townsend are among those in action.
articles.lead_paragraph: The whole tennis world will be focused on Arthur Ashe Stadium on Saturday night when Coco Gauff faces No. 1 Naomi Osaka in the third round of the United States Open (7 p.m., ESPN2).
articles.abstract: There’s more than one great match on the schedule. Rafael Nadal, Nick Kyrgios, Caroline Wozniacki and Taylor Townsend are among those in action.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open: What to Watch Saturday (Besides Osaka vs. Gauff)

articles.snippet: Roger Federer, Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic cruised to victories. Coco Gauff won again — in doubles.
articles.lead_paragraph: Novak Djokovic shook off the effects of a sore left shoulder to beat the unseeded Denis Kudla, 6-3, 6-4, 6-2, on Friday night.
articles.abstract: Roger Federer, Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic cruised to victories. Coco Gauff won again — in doubles.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open: Highlights From Friday

headline.main: Coco Gauff’s Got Game and Her Game’s Got Room to Grow

articles.snippet: Roger Federer, Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic are in action. And there’s still a chance to see Coco Gauff.
articles.lead_paragraph: Novak Djokovic, who has struggled with a sore left shoulder, looked in fine form on Friday night in his third-round match against Denis Kudla.
articles.abstract: Roger Federer, Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic are in action. And there’s still a chance to see Coco Gauff.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open: Matches to Watch on Sunday

articles.snippet: With an act of kindness, Osaka, the world No. 1, helped 15-year-old Coco Gauff process her disappointment after she lost their third-round match.
articles.lead_paragraph: Coco Gauff, at age 15 and in her first United States Open singles tournament, got it just right.
articles.abstract: With an act of kindness, Osaka, the world No. 1, helped 15-year-old Coco Gauff process her disappointment after she lost their third-round match.

headline.main: Naomi Osaka Salvages Another Awkward Moment at the U.S. Open
headline.print_headline: Osaka’s Credo: ‘Do It From the Heart’

articles.snippet: A day after her loss in singles, Coco Gauff was back in a packed stadium playing doubles with her close friend Caty McNally.
articles.lead_paragraph: It would have been understandable if Coco Gauff had come out flat, deflated by a loss the previous evening on tennis’s biggest court — a match memorable less for the thumping final score than for Gauff’s tears and the comfort she received from her opponent, top-ranked Naomi Osaka.
articles.abstract: A day after her loss in singles, Coco Gauff was back in a packed stadium playing doubles with her close friend Caty McNally.

headline.main: Team ‘McCoco’ Takes a Turn in the Spotlight
headline.print_headline: Getting a Lift From Her Teammate, Gauff Bounces Back from a Loss

articles.snippet: Naomi Osaka faces another tough challenge in her title defense, and other top young players look to make their mark on the tournament.
articles.lead_paragraph: In her first three matches, No. 1 Naomi Osaka has brushed aside concerns surrounding her injured knee in the early stages of the tournament, dropping only one set. On Saturday night, she easily pushed past Coco Gauff, the 15-year-old who has captured the world’s attention with stellar runs at Wimbledon and the United States Open.
articles.abstract: Naomi Osaka faces another tough challenge in her title defense, and other top young players look to make their mark on the tournament.

headline.main: 2019 U.S. Open: Matches to Watch on Monday

articles.snippet: Her poodle, Coco, has stolen hearts — and airtime — during her march to the U.S. Open final.
articles.lead_paragraph: Although the teenage phenom Coco Gauff was eliminated from the United States Open, an entirely different Coco endures: a furry, 7-pound brown dog belonging to Bianca Andreescu.
articles.abstract: Her poodle, Coco, has stolen hearts — and airtime — during her march to the U.S. Open final.

headline.main: In Bianca Andreescu’s Box, a Four-Legged Fan Is the Star
headline.print_headline: There’s Still One Coco Left at the Open

articles.snippet: Naomi Osaka. Coco Gauff. Bianca Andreescu. The women of the U.S. Open are holding their heads high.
articles.lead_paragraph: You’re reading In Her Words, where women rule the headlines. This installment was written by Naila-Jean Meyers, The Times’s tennis editor. Sign up here to get it delivered to your inbox. Let us know what you think at inherwords@nytimes.com.
articles.abstract: Naomi Osaka. Coco Gauff. Bianca Andreescu. The women of the U.S. Open are holding their heads high.

headline.main: At the U.S. Open, Young Women Coming Into Their Own

articles.snippet: On Friday, Gauff reached her first singles semifinal, and the next generation upset Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer.
articles.lead_paragraph: Youth ruled tennis on Friday in Shanghai, where Stefanos Tsitsipas upset No. 1 Novak Djokovic and Alexander Zverev beat his new mentor, Roger Federer.
articles.abstract: On Friday, Gauff reached her first singles semifinal, and the next generation upset Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer.

headline.main: A Big Step by Coco Gauff, Huge Leaps for a Tennis Youth Movement
headline.print_headline: Gauff Wins as Youth Wave Crests

articles.snippet: The Australian Open and then a 16th birthday await Gauff, who has already captivated audiences at Wimbledon and the U.S. Open.
articles.lead_paragraph: Coco Gauff ended her 2019 season on Saturday by winning the doubles title at the Luxembourg Open with Caty McNally. It was a triumphant finish to a year in which the 15-year-old Gauff broke onto the tennis scene with exhilarating runs at Wimbledon and the United States Open.
articles.abstract: The Australian Open and then a 16th birthday await Gauff, who has already captivated audiences at Wimbledon and the U.S. Open.

headline.main: After Breakthrough Season, What’s Next for Coco Gauff?
headline.print_headline: Grand Slam Runs and a Singles Title, All Before She Turns 16

articles.abstract: The decade belonged to Serena Williams, but its final year belonged to young stars like Ashleigh Barty, Naomi Osaka, Bianca Andreescu and Coco Gauff.
articles.snippet: The decade belonged to Serena Williams, but its final year belonged to young stars like Ashleigh Barty, Naomi Osaka, Bianca Andreescu and Coco Gauff.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was once again Serena Williams’s decade, but the last year of the 2010s was not her year, though she made her presence and power felt by reaching two Grand Slam finals.

headline.main: A New Generation of Rulers in Women’s Tennis
headline.print_headline: In Women’s Tennis, Youth Ruled in 2019
